snippet: A wiretap in a corruption case unrelated to New York’s City Council speaker, Christine Quinn, recorded a councilman’s assertion that he could extract Council money to be used as a bribe.
abstract: Wiretap played in corruption trial unrelated to New York City Council Speaker Christine Quinn ignites latest flash point in 2013 mayoral race; wiretap, which recorded former Councilman Daniel J Halloran III's assertion that he could extract tens of thousands of dollars from the City Council to be used as a bribe, abruptly resurrects questions about Quinn's oversight of a controversial City Council earmark program.
lead_paragraph: A wiretap in a corruption case unrelated to New York’s City Council speaker, Christine Quinn, recorded a councilman’s assertion that he could extract Council money to be used as a bribe.

headline.seo: With Councilman’s Boast, Rivals Revive Question of Quinn’s Oversight
headline.main: Councilman’s Boast Revives Question of Quinn’s Oversight
headline.print_headline: Councilman’s Boast, on Wiretap, Revives Question of Quinn’s Oversight

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
